text: Please find enclosed the briefing document and programme for the
planning meeting in June this year.
The intention once again is to give you the opportunity to consider
your individual markets and propose plans which will ensure
achievement of our overall Marketing and Sales objectives for your
These plans will be presented on Monday - Wednesday 25th - 27th June
to the UK Marketing Team after which the various elements will be
Once the individual market plans are agreed, these will form a part of
the Area Company Plan to be submitted to EXCO. This is the major
opportunity for you to contribute fully to the overall planning
process. Requests for special overhead projector slides should be
made to me by Monday 28th May latest. Please note latest shipments
figures will be supplied by me and OHPs will also be made available.
At this stage I hope the early provision of the briefing document will
allow you to start your preparation for this important meeting.
I suggest you consider making your presentation in sections by market
Details of accommodation etc will be supplied later.
Once again, I look forward to this opportunity of a team contribution
BATCo document for Mayo Clinic 28 March 2002
BATCo document for Mayo Clinic 28 March 2002
%th Floor Conference Room, Export House, Woking
This brief documents the requirements from field staff for formal
presentation at the June Planning meeting in Woking.
Each representative presents for discussion and agreement his
marketing plans for remainder of 1990 and 1991 for each of his
The following sections should be covered in each plan:-
5. Market Action Plan to include media/merch recommendations
A suggested layout for each section of the plan is attached in
order to streamline all the presentations.
You will need to carry out a market audit for your
particular area of responsibility in order to complete the
SWOT effectively. This audit should include national,
economic and political factors, the cigarette (and possibly
cigar) market, market and brand trends, BAT's group position
in the market place, distributor status, competition and
For your information Appendix 1 details a checklist of the
type of areas to investigate as part of your market audit.
BATCo document for Mayo Clinic 28 March 2002
Following on from the SWOT you should consider and make
assumptions about the likely developments in the following
brand trends in the market place
environmental developments with relation to marketing
To ensure that we are working to the same definitions it is
worthwhile stating "an objective states what you want to
achieve while a strategy details how you achieve your
objective". Objectives are about products and markets and
Objectives should be presented in terms of market share and
volume for existing and new brands in existing and new
These should indicate the means by which the objectives are
to be achieved and should be considered with all elements of
Consider the available product range and any
Pricing strategy statements should only be
considered if you propose that existing price
points/margins change or if you believe there will
Consider channels of distribution and the
Promotion Consider the available communication methods most
One page of key strategies - a suggested maximum of six per
market group should be presented. Consider any Associated
Company relationships activities in this section.

A separate submission should be made suggesting any new
brands required to fill identified gaps in the market place
which cannot be met from the existing portfolio.
Specific brand strategy and volume potential should be
This to include full details of merchandising activities and
operational considerations against the agreed strategies in
order to attain the market objectives. Recommendations on
type of above-the-line support should also be considered and
presented. Only complete the columns - Strategy and
Activity. Include any Distributor Training Activity.
